cell.paragraph: Debugging is the process of tracing the execution of your Project while it is running, to find any bugs that are occuring in the project. This is achieved by stepping through the Projects source code, line by line, and comparing the actual execution of the Project with the desired execution. When anomalies are found, they cannot be fixed until the debugging process is ended as you must end the debugging in order to edit the source code of the Project and recompile. This process will often be repeated until all known bugs are found.

Rather than having to execute your Project line by line until you reach the code that you wish to debug,
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/70_Debugging_Projects/breakpoints.htm break points can be set, which allow you to execute the Project normally until a breakpoint is reached, at which point the debugger will start.
cell.heading: 2The Debug Menu
cell.paragraph: Below is a screenshot of the Debug menu which contains a number of options for debugging your Project:

list.item: Windows - This menu allows you to select which debugging related windows are displayed in the Visual Studio Environment. The entries in this menu are dependent on your current debugging status.

Start - Starts execution of the project, which will run until a
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/70_Debugging_Projects/breakpoints.htm Break Point is reached.

Start Without Debugging - Starts execution of the project and ignores all
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/70_Debugging_Projects/breakpoints.htm Break Points .
Processes... - Displays a dialog allowing you to connect to an external process for debugging.
Exceptions... - Displays a dialog allowing you to set the exception checking levels, and whether to start debugging when an exception occurs.

Step Into- If you are not currently debugging then selecting this item will start the debugger, and step to the first line of execution. Selecting this entry during debugging will step into the execution of the next feature on the current line that has not yet been executed. If there is no feature on the current line to step into, then this option will step to the next line of execution in the current feature.

Step Over - If you are not currently debugging then selecting this item will start the debugger, and step to the first line of execution. Selecting this item while debugging will step to the next line of execution in the current feature, without stepping into the execution of any features on the current line.

New Breakpoint... - Displays a dialog which allows you to add new
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/70_Debugging_Projects/breakpoints.htm Break Points to your Project.

Clear All Breakpoints - Removes all assigned
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/70_Debugging_Projects/breakpoints.htm Break Points from the Project. In the screenshot above, this entry is greyed out as there are no
/10_Developing/10_Getting_Started/10_Using_ENViSioN/70_Debugging_Projects/breakpoints.htm Break Points currently defined for the project.
